Clean Phase 1 Results

clean_phase_1_results.Rd

Cleans, processes, and prepares the Phase 1 results data for further analysis. The function allows row replication, optional label assignment, and saving the cleaned data to a CSV file.

Usage

clean_phase_1_results(
  phase1_input,
  replicate_rows = NULL,
  replication_labels = NULL,
  csv_file_path = NULL
)

Arguments

phase1_input

A data frame containing Phase 1 results data.

replicate_rows

An optional integer specifying how many times to replicate the rows (e.g., 2, 3, 4). Default is NULL (no replication).

replication_labels

An optional character vector of labels (e.g., races) to assign to the replicated rows. Default is NULL.

csv_file_path

An optional path to save the cleaned data as a CSV file. If NULL, the file is saved with a timestamp in the cleaned_data directory.

Value

The cleaned data frame after processing.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
cleaned_phase1 <- clean_phase_1_results(my_data, 4, c("White", "Black", "Asian", "HIPI"), "output.csv")
} # }
